DOCNAME: VAN MELLE AND OTHERS v. THE NETHERLANDS
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: A list giving the names of the applicants is appended to the present decision .
All applicants were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
and apparent from documents available to the public , may be summarised as follows .

In TIME CARDINAL to CARDINAL DATE a fire broke out in a detention centre at GPE ( GPE ) FAC . The detainees were aliens due to be deported to other countries . CARDINAL detainees were killed , QUANTITY persons ( mostly detainees ) were injured . Surviving detainees were taken to other detention facilities .
Technical investigations led to the finding that CARDINAL of the detainees had started the fire by negligently tossing a burning cigarette into a waste paper basket .

CARDINAL of the original applicants wrote to ORG ( officier van justitie ) of ORG ( rechtbank ) of GPE on DATE asking for the prosecution of the then Minister of ORG and Minister for ORG , who in their submission bore responsibility for the events complained of . On DATE ORG informed the applicants of his refusal , ORG lacking competence in the matter ( LAW , see below ) .

On DATE the applicants lodged a complaint about the failure to prosecute with ORG ( gerechtshof ) of GPE . On DATE ORG gave a decision finding that it was not competent to order the prosecution of Government ministers and referring the matter to ORG ( PERSON ) .

On DATE the Procurator General gave an advisory opinion expressing doubts as to whether all the applicants could be found to have a sufficient interest in the case . Be that as it might , under international law – including LAW under its procedural head – it was left to domestic law to appoint the competent authority ; it was therefore not incompatible per se with LAW to make the prosecution of the CARDINAL ministers conditional on LAW or a decision of ORG of ORG .

On DATE ORG gave a decision noting the absence of LAW or decision of ORG of ORG and declaring the ORG complaint about the failure to prosecute inadmissible . This brought the domestic proceedings to an end .
In the meantime , an independent committee ( PERSON , ORG ) undertook an investigation based on the following CARDINAL questions :
Firstly , why were CARDINAL detainees killed in the fire ?
Secondly , how were the other persons involved received and taken care of afterwards ?
It submitted its report to ORG of ORG on DATE . The report itself ran to CARDINAL pages , not including CARDINAL pages of appendices and CARDINAL page of recommendations .
On the first point , the report found fault with the following CARDINAL Government institutions for having insufficient regard to fire safety :
ORG , in particular ORG ( ORG ) , responsible for laying down the applicable technical specifications and for securing the safety of the detainees ;

ORG and the Environment ( Ministerie van Volkshuisvesting , PERSON en Milieubeheer ) , and in particular ORG ( GPE ) , responsible for ordering the detention centre to be built and as owner of the building ;

the Municipality of PERSON , within whose territory the detention centre was located , responsible for issuing the necessary building licences and supervising compliance and for the local fire services .
Primary responsibility was imputed to ORG , although each of the CARDINAL parties had shown a tendency to count too heavily on the other QUANTITY doing what was needed .
As a technical matter , it was found after extensive testing that the fire could well have been started by a cigarette end and that technical failure was so unlikely a cause as to be excluded .

On the second point , the report criticised certain shortcomings in the care given to the surviving detainees following relocation but noted that some of the detainees had themselves failed to co - operate , some for example claiming false identities .
The report made recommendations to the above CARDINAL Government institutions and the Minister of the Interior and ORG ( PERSON en GPE ) .
ORG was not among the Government bodies found at fault .
The Minister of ORG and the Minister of ORG and the Environment both resigned on grounds of political responsibility shortly after this report was published .

The original applicants are a non - governmental organisation ( ORG , “ ORG ) and CARDINAL individuals . Of the latter , CARDINAL claim kinship with individuals killed in the fire ; they are applicants no . CARDINAL , PERSON , sister - in - law of the late Mr PERSON , and no . CARDINAL , Mr PERSON , cousin of the late Mr PERSON . CARDINAL , applicant no . CARDINAL , PERSON , claims kinship with a survivor , Mr PERSON .

The original applicants were later joined by former detainees who had survived the fire , namely applicants nos . CARDINAL and DATE , Mr PERSON and Mr Chafik Chnachi ( letter of CARDINAL October CARDINAL ) , and applicants ORG . CARDINAL and CARDINAL , PERSON and PERSON ( letter of DATE ) .

The detainee found to have set the waste paper basket alight , Mr PERSON , was among the survivors . He was tried for having started the fire through criminal negligence and convicted both at first instance and on appeal ; the conviction and sentence are not yet final as both the prosecution and Mr PERSON himself have appealed on points of law to ORG . Mr PERSON has also joined the case as an applicant ( no . DATE , letter of DATE ) .
At the time of the events complained of , relevant provisions of LAW provided as follows :

“ CARDINAL . If the perpetrator of a punishable act is not prosecuted , or if the prosecution is not pursued to a conclusion , then anyone with a direct interest ( rechtstreeks belanghebbende ) may lodge a written complaint with ORG within whose area of jurisdiction the decision has been taken not to prosecute or not to pursue the prosecution to a conclusion .

“ If the complaint is not within the competence of ORG , that court shall declare that it lacks competence . If ORG considers that ORG or ... ORG has competence , it shall refer the case to the court which it considers to have competence , at the same time forwarding the written complaint and a copy of its decision . ”
Article CARDINAL of the LAW for GPE ( PERSON voor het FAC ) provides as follows :

“ Members of ORG , Ministers and Deputy Ministers shall be tried for crimes committed in their official capacity by ORG , even after their resignation . The prosecution order shall be given by LAW ( koninklijk besluit ) or by a decision of ORG of ORG . ”
No such prosecution has ever been brought .
